content.description: Follow the path of least resistance up the far left side of the slab along the sidewall.
content.protection: It takes lots of pro. There are bolted anchors at the top.
content.location: Walk off left or rappel from the chains.

content.description: Climb the crack to a stance, and then face climb up to the ledge. Continue straight up past a few horizontal cracks to the top.
content.protection: There are bolted anchors at the top.
content.location: It ascends the middle of the face, to the climber's left of the black lichen streak.

content.description: Climb up and over the bulge, continuing straight up to the ledge. Follow the slab up and to the final bulge.Â
content.protection: There are bolted anchors at the top.
content.location: It ascends the middle of the face, to the climber's right of the black lichen streak.

content.description: Main Face is a sweeping ramp up to 90 feet tall with many easy variations up the slab section and a few hard lines up the adjacent vertical/barely overhung wall. The top can be reach with a quick hike up the climber trail to the left or a semi-hidden scramble that starts when the stone stairs to the left of the face start to turn left.
